summary: This is an email chain from July 6-7, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) personnel discussing the timing and content of a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment. It shows coordination around media strategy and confirms CNN was inquiring about the arrest.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the sender of the main email, instructing that the press release about Epstein should not go out until Monday unless he authorizes it.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: He is copied on an email discussing the draft press release about Epstein's indictment.

connections.description: Both are part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on the Epstein press release.

events.title: CNN inquiry about Epstein arrest
events.description: CNN contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office to confirm Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Planned press release on Epstein indictment
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office planned to issue a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein's indictment, with timing controlled by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated July 6-7, 2019, around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman directed that a press release about Epstein not be issued until Monday (July 8) unless he authorized it.
CNN had contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office to confirm Epstein's arrest, indicating media awareness of the event.
The correspondence shows internal coordination within the SDNY on managing public messaging regarding Epstein's indictment.
An attached draft indictment document is referenced, indicating the legal action was being finalized.
